title: One year of war as told by Ukrainian generals
description: Three men who were behind the success of the Ukrainian army's counteroffensives have gained hero status in the country. Coming from the post-Soviet era, they are familiar with the military culture of both Russia and NATO.

title: Singer Saad Lamjarred convicted of rape in Paris sentenced to 6 years
description: A court convicted the Moroccan singer of rape and assault charges.

title: Florida executes first prisoner in more than three years
description: Donald Dillbeck spent the last 32 years on death row after killing a woman in a parking lot in 1990 while already on the run for another murder.

title: Massive military exercise in Southern France prepares soldiers for high-intensity warfare
description: The French army has mobilized the 'Charles-de-Gaulle' aircraft carrier and over a thousand land and sea vehicles in an unprecedented large-scale military simulation.

title: French government launches study on adapting to 2°C or 4°C of global warming
description: The two scenarios, drawn from the forecasts from the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change's latest report, are to be the subject of a public consultation in the spring.

title: Ukrainians experience an unprecedented rupture with the Russian people
description: Before the invasion, Ukrainians had drawn a line between the Russian people and their government. But the war crimes have raised a barrier between the two populations, who had been described by Russian propaganda as 'brothers.'

title: Zelensky eyes 'inevitable' victory for Ukraine on anniversary of Russia conflict
description: The Ukrainian president vowed to do everything to defeat Russia as the war enters its second year.

title: Ukraine sees some value in Chinese peace plan
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Friday he was open to considering parts of a 12-point peace plan presented by Beijing.

title: EU states call for stronger borders, migrant return deals
description: The European Union is currently exploring ways for its border agency, Frontex, to operate in third-party states to dissuade migration.

title: UK rail union agrees on pay deal
description: The Transport Salaried Staffs' Association (TSSA) said its 3,000 members had voted overwhelmingly in favor of deals that include a two-year pay rise worth 9%.

title: Washington announces new round of Russia sanctions
description: The new sanctions target 250 individuals and firms as the war in Ukraine enters its second year.

title: France's Césars hope to rival American movie award ceremonies
description: The 48th edition of the French film awards will be held on Friday. The event is looking for a make-over in a bid to adapt to societal changes.

title: Man admits killing wife found dismembered in Paris park
description: A 46-year-old has admitted to killing his wife after her dismembered body was found in the Buttes-Chaumont park in northeast Paris.

title: Penguin to publish 'classic' Roald Dahl books after backlash
description: The publisher announced it would release the original versions of Roald Dahl's children's books following a wave of criticism over their re-editing for a modern audience.

title: Maternal health declines significantly in many parts of the world
description: According to a report by several UN agencies published on Thursday, a woman dies every two minutes in the world in connection with a pregnancy.

title: Friction mounts over US-Canada border crossing point loophole
description: Roxham Road, an immigration loophole between the two countries, is expected to be on the agenda of discussions between Justin Trudeau and Joe Biden during Biden's visit to Ottawa in March.

title: Bernard Squarcini, former head of French domestic intelligence, is openly sympathetic to Russia
description: In 2013, he moved to work in economic intelligence, but the former intelligence boss has been asked several times to call on his networks to support Russian oligarchs.

title: Teacher killed in Saint-Jean-de-Luz: "shock" and "anguish" after the tragedy
description: With the teenage assailant set to be indicted for what is described as a 'sudden and totally incomprehensible' act, emotions are running high in the town of Saint-Jean-de-Luz.

title: The Kyiv School of Economics is a scout on the war's economic front
description: As a start-up incubator and government advisor, the establishment is much more than a school. It also manages human resources for the territorial defense.

title: British government establishes independent regulator, but just for English football
description: Poor revenue sharing between clubs, controversial ownership, the risks of creating separate and closed leagues: The new body aims to counter English football's worst flaws.

title: Presence of six Russian MPs at OSCE assembly in Vienna causes controversy
description: Austria granted visas to the elected representatives, five of whom are under European sanctions.

title: Poland delivers first Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine
description: Poland has pledged 14 German-made Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine and Germany has promised an equal number. It was unclear how many tanks arrived on Friday.

title: After one year of war in Ukraine, Allied armies forced to adapt to Russian reality
description: Mixing traditional weapons such as tanks with more modern inventions like drones, the war in Ukraine has compelled Western forces to review their strategies.

title: On the front line in Kreminna, Ukrainian soldiers are 'holding on'
description: For four months, the Sturm Battalion has been resisting the Russian forces that have resumed the offensive at the edge of the occupied Luhansk region in Donbas.

title: After a year of war in Ukraine, diplomacy reaches an impasse at the UN
description: Two additional countries voted on Thursday against a resolution demanding the withdrawal of Russian troops from Ukraine, bringing to six the number of declared supporters of Moscow.

title: Harvey Weinstein begs for 'mercy' as he is sentenced to 16 years for another rape
description: The former movie mogul is already serving a 23-year sentence for his separate 2020 conviction in New York for sex crimes.

title: Russian propaganda stirs up hatred against a 'Ukronazi' government
description: Since the beginning of the war, state media and 'patriotic' Telegram channels have been spreading a myth inherited from the Soviet era that Russia is always the victim and never the aggressor.

title: Serial burnout spreads among Danish politicians
description: The sick leave for the government's number two, Jakob Ellemann-Jensen is just the latest in a long list revealing the extent of burnout that has hit the country's political figures.

title: France's railroad company SNCF reports record profit in 2022
description: The state-owned company's net profit of €2.4 billion is to be used to modernize the network and reduce the company's debt.

title: 'This will be the year of our victory': Zelensky on anniversary of war in Ukraine
description: To mark the first anniversary of the Russian invasion, the Ukrainian president tweeted a message of support and encouragement for his people, promising that '2023 will be the year of our victory.'

title: Rumilly, France: The 'world capital of the frying pan' and a 'forever chemical' hotspot
description: The water tables of the eastern French town are contaminated by a chemical compound banned since 2020 and long used by Tefal for the non-stick coating of its cookware.

title: 'Forever chemicals': In France, nearly 1,000 PFAS-contaminated sites are largely ignored
description: The investigation by 'Le Monde' and 17 media partners revealed the presence of dozens of French sites where the pollution levels are considered hazardous to health. The authorities, who are unaware of the extent of the problem, have been slow to act.

title: Vladimir Putin: The obsessions of a warmongering president
description: The head of the Kremlin enjoys the drama while insisting on showing that 'the special military operation' is not disturbing the daily life of his fellow citizens.

title: At the Centre Pompidou in Paris, the chromatic intensity of Sayed Haider Raza's work
description: The Centre Pompidou in Paris is devoting a retrospective to one of India's most famous artists.

title: After year of war, Western objections to supporting Ukraine are limited but growing
description: Despite the effects of the war on their economies, the billions spent on military and humanitarian aid and the influx of refugees, the people and governments from Western countries remain largely supportive of Ukraine, even if a decline is apparent.

title: China presents peace talks proposal to end the conflict in Ukraine
description: US State Department spokesman Ned Price said earlier Thursday that the US would reserve judgment but that China’s allegiance with Russia meant it was not a neutral mediator.

title: In the Huveaune Valley, 'the river flow has never been so low in February'
description: Placed on 'reinforced alert' since mid-February, the basin of this coastal river has been subject to water use restrictions, from its source in the Var to its mouth in Marseille.

title: War in Ukraine: Le Monde's reporter Florence Aubenas answers readers' questions
description: Le Monde's reporter at large answered questions from readers during an online question-and-answer session.

title: Emmanuel Macron's honoring of Jeff Bezos strongly criticized by La France Insoumise MPs
description: The president decorated the founder of Amazon at the Elysée Palace on Thursday, February 16 with the Légion d'Honneur – France's highest order of merit. Many left-wing MPs saw this as deplorable.

title: South Korean court recognizes right for same-sex couple in landmark ruling
description: A South Korean court of appeals has granted a man in a same-sex couple the right to benefit from their partner's health coverage, even though same-sex marriage is not lega in the country.
